API Reference¶

Database Utilities¶

load_data.create_connection(db_name, db_user, db_password, db_host, db_port)¶

Create a PostgreSQL connection using the supplied credentials.

Parameters:

  • db_name (str) – Name of the PostgreSQL database to connect to.

  • db_user (str) – Database user that should be authenticated.

  • db_password (str) – Password associated with db_user.

  • db_host (str) – Hostname or address where the database is running.

  • db_port (str) – TCP port for the PostgreSQL service.

Returns:

A live psycopg connection when successful, otherwise None when an psycopg.OperationalError is encountered.

Return type:

psycopg.Connection | None

load_data.execute_query(connection, query)¶

Execute a raw SQL statement on the provided connection.

Autocommit mode is enabled prior to execution so DDL statements take effect immediately.

Parameters:

  • connection (psycopg.Connection) – Open database connection that will issue the query.

  • query (str) – SQL text that should be executed.

Returns:

None

Return type:

None

load_data.load_data()¶

Run the full data-loading pipeline for the admissions dataset.

This helper creates the database and table if needed, refreshes the applicants table from llm_extend_applicant_data.json, and prints a summary count of stored rows.

Returns:

None

Return type:

None

load_data.load_json_to_db(json_path, db_user, db_password, db_host, db_port)¶

Load the cleaned applicant JSON document into the applicants table.

The target table is truncated prior to inserting the refreshed dataset.

Parameters:

  • json_path (str) – Filesystem path to the cleaned JSON payload.

  • db_user (str) – Database user with insert privileges.

  • db_password (str) – Password for db_user.

  • db_host (str) – Hostname of the PostgreSQL server.

  • db_port (str) – Port exposed by the PostgreSQL server.

Returns:

None

Return type:

None

load_data.setup_database(db_user, db_password, db_host, db_port)¶

Provision the gradcafe database if it does not already exist.

Parameters:

  • db_user (str) – Administrative PostgreSQL user.

  • db_password (str) – Password for db_user.

  • db_host (str) – Hostname of the PostgreSQL server.

  • db_port (str) – Port exposed by the PostgreSQL server.

Returns:

None

Return type:

None

load_data.setup_table(db_user, db_password, db_host, db_port)¶

Ensure the applicants table exists inside gradcafe.

Parameters:

  • db_user (str) – PostgreSQL user with permissions to create tables.

  • db_password (str) – Password for db_user.

  • db_host (str) – Hostname of the PostgreSQL server.

  • db_port (str) – Port exposed by the PostgreSQL server.

Returns:

None

Return type:

None

Analysis Queries¶

query_data.run_queries(db_name, db_user, db_password, db_host, db_port)¶

Execute the canned analysis queries and print their results.

Parameters:

  • db_name (str) – Name of the database containing the applicants table.

  • db_user (str) – Database user that should be authenticated.

  • db_password (str) – Password associated with db_user.

  • db_host (str) – Hostname or address where the PostgreSQL instance lives.

  • db_port (str) – TCP port for the PostgreSQL service.

Returns:

None

Return type:

None

Cleaning Pipeline¶

class homework_sample_code.course_app.clean.Cleaner(raw_data)¶

Bases: object

clean_data()¶

Normalise the raw GradCafe entries into the application schema.

Returns:

Cleaned applicant records suitable for persistence.

Return type:

list[dict]

Scraping Pipeline¶

class homework_sample_code.course_app.scrape.Scraper(url='https://www.thegradcafe.com/survey/', max_entries=30000)¶

Bases: object

scrape_data(existing_urls=None)¶

Iteratively download survey pages and return unseen applicant rows.

Parameters:

existing_urls (set[str]) – URLs that have already been ingested and should terminate scraping if encountered again.

Returns:

List of raw entry dictionaries extracted from the survey.

Return type:

list[dict]
